title: Vintage Toy Brands
description: How well do you remember the iconic toy companies that filled shelves with childhood magic? Test your knowledge of the brands behind the toys!

questions.question: Hasbro, one of the world's largest toy companies, started out selling what product in 1923?
What does the name 'Mattel' come from?
options: A combination of founders' names, Harold Matson and Elliot Handler

questions.question: Fisher-Price, the beloved children's toy company, was founded in which year?
The Ohio Art Company is best known for manufacturing which iconic toy?
Wham-O, the company behind the Frisbee and Hula Hoop, got its name from what?
options: The sound of a slingshot hitting a target

questions.question: What was Parker Brothers' first big hit game, published in 1883?
Milton Bradley, famous for board games, originally started his company to produce what?
The Tonka toy company was named after Lake Minnetonka in which state?
What material were the original Tonka trucks made from, making them nearly indestructible?
Kenner Products introduced which breakfast-time-inspired toy oven in 1963?
The Ideal Toy Company is credited with creating which classic bear toy after a famous hunting story involving Theodore Roosevelt?
Louis Marx and Company was once the largest toy manufacturer in the world. Where was the company headquartered?
LEGO bricks, which became popular in America in the 1960s, originated in which country?
What does the name LEGO come from?
Which toy company, known for chemistry sets and microscopes, used the slogan 'Hello Boys! Make Lots of Toys!'?
